question: 沿う
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>run alongside</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to run alongside</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Imagine yourself on a path designed <vocabulary>to run alongside</vocabulary> an endless array of <reading>so</reading>ap (<ja>そ</ja>) bars. As you walk alongside the soap bars, you enjoy their delightful scents. It's a "scent-sational" promenade with soap bars that leaves you feeling squeaky clean!
